sen.j: 奈良盆地（ならぼんち）とは、日本の奈良県北西部に位置する標高100メートル以下の断層盆地を指す。
sen.e: Nara Basin is a fault basin which has an altitude of below 100 meters and is located in the northwestern area of Nara Prefecture in Japan.
Nara Basin is a fault basin which has an altitude of below 100 meters and is located in the northwestern area of Nara Prefecture in Japan.
Nara Basin is a fault basin which has an altitude of below 100 meters and is located in the northwestern area of Nara Prefecture in Japan.
It is also called "Yamato Basin".
It is also called 'Yamato Basin.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を調整" " → ' '
sen.e: It is also called 'Yamato Basin.'

sen.j: 東西に約15キロメートル、南北に約30キロメートルの面積を持ち、菱形をなしている。
sen.e: It has an area of approximately fifteen kilometers from east to west, and approximately thirty kilometers from north to south, and is rhomboid-shaped.
It has an area of approximately fifteen kilometers from east to west, and approximately thirty kilometers from north to south, and is rhomboid-shaped.

sen.j: またこの盆地を流れる佐保川・富雄川などは大和川に合流し、西流して大阪湾に注いでいる。
sen.e: Also, rivers running in this basin such as Saho-gawa River and Tomio-gawa River meet Yamato-gawa River and flow westward into Osaka Bay.
Also, rivers running in this basin such as Saho-gawa River and Tomio-gawa River meet Yamato-gawa River and flow westward into Osaka Bay.
Also, rivers running in this basin such as Saho-gawa River and Tomio-gawa River meet Yamato-gawa River and flow westward into Osaka Bay.

sen.j: 一般的には盆地部の他に矢田丘陵・赤膚丘陵・京阪奈丘陵（奈良県域）・馬見丘陵などを含むことが多い。
sen.e: Generally speaking, the term "Nara Basin" often refers to include Yata-kyuryo Hills, Akahada-kyuryo Hills, Keihanna-kyuryo Hills (in Nara Prefecture), and Umami-kyuryo Hills, etc. other than the basin region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Generally speaking, the term "Nara Basin" often refers to the area including Yata-kyuryo Hills, Akahada-kyuryo Hills, Keihanna-kyuryo Hills (in Nara Prefecture), and Umami-kyuryo Hills, etc. other than the basin region.

Generally speaking, the term "Nara Basin" often refers to the area including Yata-kyuryo Hills, Akahada-kyuryo Hills, Keihanna-kyuryo Hills (in Nara Prefecture), and Umami-kyuryo Hills, etc. other than the basin region.

sen.j: また、戦後は奈良市中心部や大阪市、京都市などへのベッドタウンとして盆地部の人口が増加し、矢田丘陵北部や赤膚丘陵や馬見丘陵では日本のニュータウンの開発がかなり進められた。
sen.e: Furthermore in the postwar period, the population in the basin region increased as it became a commuter town to the center of Nara City, and to Osaka City and Kyoto City, etc.; in northern part of Yata-kyuryo Hills and Akahada-kyuryo Hills, Japanese new towns developed significantly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore in the postwar period, the population in the basin region increased as it became a commuter town to the center of Nara City, and to Osaka City and Kyoto City, etc.; in northern part of Yata-kyuryo Hills and Akahada-kyuryo Hills, Japanese new towns developed significantly.

Furthermore in the postwar period, the population in the basin region increased as it became a commuter town to the center of Nara City, and to Osaka City and Kyoto City, etc.; in northern part of Yata-kyuryo Hills and Akahada-kyuryo Hills, Japanese new towns developed significantly.

sen.j: 京阪奈丘陵の一部は関西文化学術研究都市の奈良県域として開発されている。
sen.e: A part of Keihanna-kyuryo Hills is being developed as an area of Kansai Science City which belongs to Nara Prefecture.
A part of Keihanna-kyuryo Hills is being developed as an area of Kansai Science City which belongs to Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: これら丘陵地の一部には天野川や木津川 (京都府)など淀川水系に注ぐ河川もある。
sen.e: A part of these hills includes rivers flowing into Yodo-gawa Water System such as Amano-gawa River and Kizu-gawa River (Kyoto Prefecture).
A part of these hills includes rivers flowing into Yodo-gawa Water System such as Amano-gawa River and Kizu-gawa River (Kyoto Prefecture).
A part of these hills includes rivers flowing into Yodo-gawa Water System such as Amano-gawa River and Kizu-gawa River (Kyoto Prefecture).

sen.j: 人口は奈良県全域（約140万人）の86%に当たる約120万人を占める。
sen.e: It has the population of 1.2 million, which is eighty-six percent of the population of the whole area of Nara Prefecture (approximately 1.4 million).
It has the population of 1.2 million, which is eighty-six percent of the population of the whole area of Nara Prefecture (approximately 1.4 million).

sen.j: 平安京への遷都以前、奈良時代までは政治・文化の中心地として栄えた地域である。
sen.e: Before the transfer of the capital to Heiankyo (ancient capital in current Kyoto) until the Nara period, this area flourished as the political and cultural center.
Before the transfer of the capital to Heiankyo (ancient capital in current Kyoto) until the Nara period, this area flourished as the political and cultural center.

sen.j: 旧大和国の内で、奈良盆地に当たる場所を国中（くんなか）、山間部を山中（さんちゅう）とも呼ぶ。
sen.e: The place in the old Yamato Province which corresponds to Nara Basin is also called Kunnaka, and the sankanbu (mountain-ringed region) is also called Sanchu.
The place in the old Yamato Province which corresponds to Nara Basin is also called Kunnaka, and the sankanbu (mountain-ringed region) is also called Sanchu.

sen.j: 盆地ではあるが、冬は温暖で過ごしやすい。
sen.e: Although it is a basin, in winter the climate is mild and comfortable.
Although it is a basin, in winter the climate is mild and comfortable.
Although it is a basin, in winter the climate is mild and comfortable.

sen.j: 夏季の熱帯夜は10日ほどしかない。
sen.e: Sweltering nights in summer season only last for about ten days.
Sweltering nights in summer season only last for about ten days.
